UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: The antimicrobial peptide ZY4 combats multidrug-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Acinetobacter baumannii infection.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2019;116:26516-2622
Literature.Author: Mwangi J, Yin YL, Wang G, Yang M, Li Y, Zhang Z, Lai R

Literature.Title: Lysine Stapling Screening Provides Stable and Low Toxic Cationic Antimicrobial Peptides Combating Multidrug-Resistant Bacteria In Vitro and In Vivo
Literature.Author: Hu Y, et al.

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human erythrocytes:50% Hemolysis=>320 µg/ml,Human erythrocytes:31.7±4.2% Hemolysis=320 µg/ml,Human erythrocytes:10% Hemolysis=>128 µg/ml,Human embryonic kidney HEK293T cells:LC50=128 µg/ml
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=4.6µM),Bacillus subtilis(MIC=9.2µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 2592(MIC=9.2µM),Candida albicans SC5314(MIC=4.6µM),Listeria monocytogenes(MIC=16µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus BNCC 186335(MIC=4µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=8µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa BNCC 125486(MIC=8µg/ml),Escherichia coli BNCC 133264(MIC=2µg/ml),Escherichia coli(MIC=16µg/ml)
